item.title: Actors and Stakeholders
item.description: The Austrian energy system is based on complex interactions between various actors who ensure grid stability, energy distribution, and market regulation. Specialized institutions work closely together, from controlling electricity flows to billing energy consumption data. This article provides an overview of who these actors are and the roles they play.
